location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.56 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is confirmation that Sheikh Mahomed ben Khuleefa [Muhammad bin Khalifa] has paid the sum of 116 dollars to a Bahraini inhabitant, originally taken from the latter by the Sheikh's dependents. The letter contains a translated extract of correspondence from Sheikh Muhammad bin Khalifa to Kemball, dated 6 February 1853, in which Sheikh Muhammad confirms the restoration of money via the Bahrain Agent Hajee Jassim, which he understood to already have been completed until he received Kemball's letter.
